timeseries_qmc.boltzmann

class timeseries_qmc.boltzmann.ApproximateBoltzmannWeight(model: Model, beta: float)

Bases: BoltzmannWeightCalculator

Class for calculating Botlzmann weights of a model approximately by assuming that the local density of states is a Gaussian centered at the energy of the state and whose varaince equals the energy variance of the state.

Parameters:

  • model (models.Model) – Model Hamilotonain.

  • beta (float) – inverse temperature.

calculate(psi_bitstring: list | ndarray) → tuple[float, float, float]

Inherited method. See BoltzmannWeightCalculator.calculate().

class timeseries_qmc.boltzmann.BoltzmannWeightCalculator

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for calculating Botlzmann weights and the associated local energy moments.

abstract calculate(psi_bitstring: list | ndarray) → tuple[float, float, float]

Calculate the Boltzmann weight of a state and the first and second moments of its local energy.

Parameters:

psi_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing some product state \(|\psi\rangle\).

Returns:

  • w (float) – Boltzmann weight \(\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H}|\psi \rangle\).

  • e (float) – Local value of energy \({\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H} H |\psi \rangle}/ {\langle\psi| e^{\beta H}|\psi \rangle}\).

  • e_sq (float) – Local value of energy’s second moment \({\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H} H^2 |\psi \rangle}/ {\langle\psi| e^{\beta H}|\psi \rangle}\).

class timeseries_qmc.boltzmann.ExactBoltzmannWeight(model: Model, beta: float)

Bases: BoltzmannWeightCalculator

Class for calculating Botlzmann weights of a model exactly.

Parameters:

  • model (models.Model) – Model Hamilotonain.

  • beta (float) – inverse temperature.

calculate(psi_bistring: list | ndarray) → tuple[float, float, float]

Inherited method. See BoltzmannWeightCalculator.calculate().

class timeseries_qmc.boltzmann.FourierTransform(beta: float, loschmidt_echo_evaluator: LoschmidtEchoEvaluator, t_max: float, n_t: int, n_omega: int = 1024, omega_max: float | None = None, delta: float | None = None, cutoff_factor: float = 2)

Bases: BoltzmannWeightCalculator

Class for calculating Botlzmann weights from time series of Loschmidt echo via direct Fourier trasnfrom.

Parameters:

  • beta (float) – Inverse temperature.

  • loschmidt_echo_evaluator (loschmidt.LoschmidtEchoEvaluator) – Evaluator of Loschimidt echos used to calculate the time series.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time used to evaluate Loschmidt echos.

  • n_t (int) – Number of time points used to evaluate Loschmidt echos.

  • n_omega (int) – Number of points of the frequency grid used to recostruct the local density of states.

  • omega_max (float) – Maximum frequency of the grid used to reconstruct the local density of states. If None is used, Nyquist frequency is used based on the specified time parameters.

  • delta (float) – Inverse of the width of the Gaussian filter used on the time series. Note that this Gaussian filter effectively broadens the density of states by delta. If None is used, the reciprocal of the maximum time is used.

  • cutoff_factor (float) – Parameter \(C\) controlling the cutoff on the density of states. The actual cutoff is \(C\) times the maximum absolute value of the negative part of the density.

calculate(psi_bitstring: list) → tuple[float, float, float]

Inherited method. See BoltzmannWeightCalculator.calculate().

estimate_density(psi_bitstring: list | ndarray) → tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, float]

Esimate the local density of states.

Parameters:

psi_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing some product state \(|\psi\rangle\).

Returns:

  • D (numpy.ndarray) – Local density of state.

  • omega (numpy.ndarray) – Grid points on which the local density of states is evaluated.

  • d_omega (float) – Grid spacing of omega.

class timeseries_qmc.boltzmann.NNLS(model: Model, beta: float, loschmidt_echo_evaluator: LoschmidtEchoEvaluator, t_max: float, n_t: int, n_omega: int = 256, omega_max: float | None = None, delta_factor: float = 2, discrepency_factor: float = 1, norm_relative_weight: float = 10, adjust_moments: bool = True)

Bases: BoltzmannWeightCalculator

Class for calculating Botlzmann weights from time series of Loschmidt echo via non-negative least squares.

Parameters:

  • model (models.Model) – Model Hamiltonain.

  • beta (float) – Inverse temperature.

  • loschmidt_echo_evaluator (loschmidt.LoschmidtEchoEvaluator) – Evaluator of Loschimidt echos used to calculate the time series.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time used to evaluate Loschmidt echos.

  • n_t (int) – Number of time points used to evaluate Loschmidt echos.

  • n_omega (int) – Number of points of the frequency grid used to recostruct the local density of states.

  • omega_max (float) – Maximum frequency of the grid used to reconstruct the local density of states. If None is used, Nyquist frequency is used based on the specified time parameters.

  • delta_factor (float) – Parameter \(C_\delta\) used to determine the inverse width of the Gaussian filter used on the time series. The inverse width is \(C_\delta\) times the spacing of the frequency grid.

  • discrepency_factor (float) – Parameter \(C_d\) used to determine the expected weighted error on the time series. The expected weighted error is \(C_d\) times the total number of data points (which, in turm, is twice the number of time points).

  • adjust_moments (bool) – Whether to fix the norm, mean and varaince of the local density of states to their exact values after performing the quantile filter.

  • norm_relative_weight (float) – The relative weight of the norm data point (i.e. t=0) with respect to the rest of the time series.

calculate(psi_bitstring: list) → tuple[float, float, float]

Inherited method. See BoltzmannWeightCalculator.calculate().

estimate_density(psi_bitstring: list | ndarray) → tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, float]

Esimate the local density of states.

Parameters:

psi_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing some product state \(|\psi\rangle\).

Returns:

  • D (numpy.ndarray) – Local density of state.

  • omega (numpy.ndarray) – Grid points on which the local density of states is evaluated.

  • d_omega (float) – Grid spacing of omega.
